title: Transcendence is balanced and Black Cleaver is balanced.
body:
It's just the combination of the two that makes this broken.

Don't go gutting either of them, just make the CDR on {{item:3071}} unique

What makes broken what? 
that extra 25 ad from 20 cdr? 
Why not get 20 lethality instead? And some usefull passives? Like {{item:3814}} or {{item:3812}} 
What a nonsense, paying 3k for 65 ad and 400 hp.

Um... it's kinda the defacto tank shredding item used by juggernauts to absolutely ruin their laning opponents. It also gives them movement speed for dealing physical damage, something juggernauts need.

It's THE class defining item.
But stacking them doesn't bust tanks harder. I have played a few games with cleaver stacking and it simply isn't that terribly strong. It's just super safe.

You're right - the passive doesn't stack.  What's making the Black Cleaver stacking so oppressive is that assassins can stack them, get tanky, and still get bonus AD from Transcendence and the AD on Black Cleaver, and then be hard to kill while stomping squishies who can't easily kill them anymore.

True, but the point of this thread is buying multiple BCs. The armor shred does not stack. You get the same amount of armor shred with 1 BC as with 5 BCs.
It's because the Black Cleaver is one of the few complete AD item that is by itself gold efficient on stats alone, even without transcendence.
Every single ADC item is more than gold efficient from stats alone. . . Before you even account for the multiplicative value of their stats.

> [{quoted}](name=PB4UAME,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rQkzk5aT,comment-id=000100020001,timestamp=2017-11-13T20:28:18.444+0000)

> Every single ADC item is more than gold efficient from stats alone. . . Before you even account for the multiplicative value of their stats.

Yep, and yet people are complaining that people MIGHT stack black cleavers.

I'm more worried about some ADC going something like essence reaver, phantom dancer IE, triforce, black cleaver+random boots or another crit item. Fast as heck, and yet tons of AD, has shred built in, and furthermore is tanky as heck. Only thing missing is lifesteal and you could easily make the last item a death's dance to just give people cancer.

But just because it's gold efficient doesn't mean it's worth stacking the and losing the gold worth that Rage and Shred do.

Rage is worth 300 gold if you're consistent with it, Shred is worth over 1000 if you get 5 stacks on a tank

This seems like the likely adjustment to make.

One other consideration worth making is if the effect on Transcendence is properly tuned outside of the "abuse stacking a bunch of the same 20% CDR item" case. We'll have to look into that part as well as Runes tuning carries on into the coming months.
Honestly I'd suggest making cdr on _every_ item unique, just to make sure this doesn't happen again.

on Items that bulds into another items it already is unique. And most items are just not worth stackign for their unique passives and the stats they give (or even unique actives). And the other ones already have unique cdr (nashors/warmogs). And Bc is like these 2 cause it gives you good stats: Much ad and much health. i mean if you realy just want to stack spirit visages while there are plenty of mr AND Cdr items, well than you already waste potential. No need to change that cd into unique cdr. If you just buy frozen hearts you will have much cdr for transcendence and much armor, but literaly nearly no health AND you are weak to magic damage.

I've often wondered, why not just make all finished items unique?  Is there a reason for allowing players to build 2-4 of the same finished item?  The only times I see this is if there is a game breaking thing like now or when people are trolling.

The black cleaver stacking is nowhere near as viable as people make it out to be. And on the other hand, removing all finished items stacking would prevent people from coming up with interesting strats.

Could you give me an example of when it wouldn't be fair?  

I'm sorry but I just can't figure out any finished item that you need to or ever should build 2-4 of.  To clarify, when I say finished item I mean items like {{item:3102}} {{item:3174}} {{item:3742}} and not items that build into things like {{item:3144}} {{item:1042}} {{item:3801}}

Currently there's no real case where you might want to stack the same item except for example maybe nashors tooth with transcendence. The issue here isn't that. The issue here is even in this one case, it's not even strong and moreso lackluster than anything else. So preventing stacking items would only actually prevent people from doing fun stupid shit/trying weird shit. Hence it is enforcing a certain gameplay rather than anything else. More power to the player is always my motto. Next thing you know we're demanding Riot to mail people pacifiers that they must suck on to play this game.

How does building {{item:3153}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3153}} create more fun for someone other then they are trolling?  If you want more fun combining additional items with unique passives is what does it not stacking 4 of the same item.  You have kind of proved my point, the only time people do this is to troll or because the system breaks the item to give you an advantage. There really isn't any item that building 4 of makes it more fun except in the cases of trolling.  For the record {{item:3070}} is not a finished item so you can still {{item:3070}} up when you team loses.  

What does happen is occasionally certain items can be stacked up to do stupid stuff.  Remember supports building {{item:3504}} {{item:3504}} {{item:3504}} {{item:3504}}?  There have been many situations in which an item is given too many stats and people just buy 4 of them to take advantage of it.  I would also add that making finished items unique would make it easier for new players to buy items as they can't accidentally buy the same item twice clearing up purchasing a bit for them.  many new players see {{item:3072}} with the unique +20% life steal and think they can't get anymore lifesteal.  Not to mention that used to be an item that people purchased 4 of to have 80% lifesteal on auto attacks.  Draven was a nightmare then.

This doesn't really detract for unique builds either it just prevents trolling.  Now if there was a genuine item added that was meant to be made multiple times it would be different.  It would also be easier just to give it the ability to be built multiple times rather then combing through all items to find one that is unhealthy to be stacked.

I guess my question is: why not make it so that end tier items cannot be purchased more than once? This means you can't buy 2 boots, 2 sunfire capes, 2 BC and such.

I understand you use "unique passives" to have this to a certain degree, but to me right now it seems like you are beating around the bush instead of cutting the problem by the roots

The Cleaver stacking isn't really even that broken imo.  I've seen it in a few of my games and the person doing it didn't pop off and go 30/0 or something like that.  It's viable, but it's not super op or broken.  No reason to change it tbh.

It's not a build that's going to just curb-stomp everyone, no.  But it is a build that makes assassins like Zed or Talon able to get more raw AD, HP, and one bit of armor shred, and get bonus AD from Transcendence.  Something doesn't have to be hotfix-worthy to be overpowered.  Stacking Black Cleavers with Transcendence gives you more value from the items even without the unique passives stacking.  And making Zed's HP pool to around 4k while still being able to put out similar damage on immobile squishies is not a balanced state of affairs, especially given how cheap Black Cleavers are compared to other damage items assassins would normally build.  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qgbZNCzbqOM

I'd much rather have other good passives and actives from other items instead of just getting some bonus AD from stacking the same item.  Just because an item is gold efficient, doesn't mean it's slot efficient.  The build is still decent, but it is nowhere near broken.

Is this even broken? I've seen it a few times but not with crazy results.

I imagine the solution they'll go with is in fact the one you've outlined, however. This seems to be the only major abuse case.
All they have to do is make the 20% CD unique

I don't think the two combined are actually broken. You'd actually get more damage if you picked up Lethality. _Maybe_ {{item:3147}} {{item:3142}} and 3x{{item:3071}} would be strong, but even then it's not _that_ great a combo. You'd actually probably end up getting more damage by stealing IE and Bloodthirster, alongside BC, Duskblade, and Youmuu's, and throwing in {{item:3158}} for a bit more CDR damage.

Honestly, this rune is only really helping enchanter supports. Works well when every goddamned enchanter item has CDR. Gives you a nice extra boost of damage and healing as {{champion:37}}.

Although it _would_ be smart to make BC's CDR unique now, just to be safe.

I was curious so I thought I'd do the math on some high CDR builds.

**Cleaver Stacking**
{{item:3071}}{{item:3071}}{{item:3071}}{{item:3071}}{{item:3071}}{{item:3158}}
Cost:  15,900 Gold

2000 HP
200 AD
110% CDR

With transcendence gives 120% and converts to X=1.2(120-40)= 96 AD, Giving a grand total of 296 AD

Stacking the Cleavers seems pretty gold efficient for giving yourself a lot of health and AD and not much else.

**Semi-Standard Assassin Build**
{{item:3812}}{{item:3071}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3158}} 
Cost: 16,450 Gold

400 HP
45 MR
280 AD
40 Lethality
70% CDR

With transcendence gives 80% and converts to X=1.2(80-40)= 48 AD, Giving a grand total of 328 AD

This build gives you ok durability and a lot of damage against targets of varying armor values. Costs about 500 Gold more than Cleaver stacking.

You could also swap in {{item:3800}} instead of {{item:3142}} for

**Bruiser-ish Build**
Cost: 16,200 Gold

800 HP
300 Mana
30 Armor
45 MR
225 AD
20 Lethality
70% CDR

With transcendence gives 80% and converts to X=1.2(80-40)= 48 AD, Giving a grand total of 273 AD

This gives less flat health than the cleaver build but it probably offers similar if not better durability with resistances, death's dance/Hexdrinker passive, and lifesteal factored in. Comparable flat AD with a bonus burst from Duskblade and its lethality, and it gives an engage/slow. 300 Gold more than cleaver stacking.


**Personal Conclusion:**

Cleaver stacking is a little overrated. Main issue I see is that you have flat health with no resistances meaning that you will still get shredded pretty quickly. Flat penetration is still going to be very effective against you while you are also susceptible to effects from {{item:3036}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3151}}, and have no way to sustain back up. You could put together a better build with more damage, durability, and utility, tailored to suit the team you are up against, by mixing and matching tank/bruiser items with assassin ones. Cleaver stacking is absolutely viable, but it's probably not ideal in any situation. I don't really see much of a reason to remove this interaction aside from preventing mindless, inefficient builds.
inb4 Riot first guts the item and then the mastery, leaving both in an useless state instead of just making the CDR unique.

I'm kind of a fan of locking items such that you can only ever have 1. I know that this will ruin a very popular build ({{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}) but I think it's for the best.
